title: These Office-Ready Looks Will Heat Up Your Winter Work Wardrobe
description: Let Selena Gomez, J.Lo, and other celebrities inspire your next outfit.
excerpt: Let Selena Gomez, J.Lo, and other celebrities inspire your next outfit.
text: Winter is, inevitably, a tough season to dress for—and even more so at the office. With the weather fluctuating between freezing and mild, it’s easy to reach for your standard knit sweaters, long-sleeve dresses, wool trousers, tights, and boots. That said, even the most creative dressers can find themselves in a sartorial rut every now and then. So, allow me to reinvigorate your wardrobe with some new winter workwear inspiration.Ahead, I’ve rounded up some of the chicest office-appropriate ensembles to inspire your next cold-weather outfit. Taking a page from the most stylish celebrities and street style mavens, you’ll quickly see that the art of layering (particularly with outerwear and knits) will be crucial to master this season, whether that involves throwing on a blazer, draping a sweater over your shoulders, or even switching between a trench coat and a puffer jacket. I’ve also provided options that run the range of dress codes—so, yes, there are some really good winter work outfits with jeans included.So, what are you waiting for? Find your next work look below.Cold-Weather LeatherA long leather skirt styled with an oversized blazer and tall boots is the perfect (and foolproof) outfit for when you want a chic and elevated look. Make it a monochromatic by matching your skirt to your top and tie it all together with a belt for a subtle but impactful detail—the contrast of your jacket makes it really pop.Alice + Olivia Macey Denim Notch-Collar Fitted BlazerAGOLDE Karla TankNow 61% OffCamila Coelho Anabella Leather Maxi SkirtBy Anthropologie Wide Corset BeltStuart Weitzman Naomi 50MM Crocodile-Embossed Leather BootsRay-Ban 53MM Pillow SunglassesWinter Jeans and a TeeWhen your office runs on the casual side—or you work from home—a simple outfit like this one is a no-brainer. Throw on your favorite loafers and a long wool coat, and you’re good to go.Toteme Classic Doublé Wool CoatBuck Mason Surplus Rib Scoop Neck TankAGOLDE Harper JeansMadewell The Grayson Penny LoaferGivenchy Cat-Eye SunglassesDavid Yurman Madison Necklace with ToggleAll-Black EverythingYou can never go wrong with dark neutrals in the winter, especially an all-black ensemble. And when you pair it with sleek earrings and classic pumps like the newly engaged Selena Gomez, it’ll become your go-to winter work outfit.Banana Republic Barathea Relaxed Italian Wool Tuxedo JacketBanana Republic High-Rise Wide-Leg Wool PantBardot Como BodysuitStuart Weitzman Stuart Power PumpsToteme Double Clasp Leather BeltGorjana Preston Drop EarringsThe Updated CardiganAn oversized wool cardigan adds a cozy layer to your outfit, especially when the freezing temps are outside of the office and inside. Take a cue from Jennifer Lopez and wear yours over a black leather skirt and a classic button-up collared shirt for the quintessential layered winter look. Polo Ralph Lauren Relaxed-Fit Cotton ShirtJoe’s Jeans The Martine Maxi SkirtThe Frankie Shop Emi Long Felted Wool CardiganMonica Vinader Siren Muse Chunky Medium Hoop EarringsNow 50% OffCeline 60mm Flat Top SunglassesStuart Weitzman Everitt 80 BootieNow 40% OffClassic SuitingGo back to business casual basics with a matching grey suit à la Phoebe Dynevor. For a modern take, wear a colorful tank underneath and pair it with leather boots. After all, the most reliable option in the winter is sometimes the best, especially with the unpredictability of the weather.Mango Pinstripe Suit JacketMango Pinstripe Suit TrousersJoe’s Jeans The Lucia Single-Breasted Coat Aritzia Contour Squareneck Cami Hip TankEverlane The City Boot Zoe Lev Jewelry 14k Gold Small Huggie EarringsScandi ChicNothing feels quite as chic as a winter coat with faux-fur trim—just ask Alessandra Ambrosio (as well as all the Danish girls sporting the style). Style it with a cashmere and wool turtleneck sweater, which adds luxe and warmth. Without a doubt, this is an outerwear staple that dresses up just about anything: skirts, trousers, your trusted denim jeans, you name it. And don’t forget a pair of kitten-heeled boots, the ultimate winter work shoe.Vince Wool & Cashmere-Blend Turtleneck SweaterLevi’s Ribcage Full Length JeansSaint Laurent Beveled Acetate Cat-Eye SunglassesStand Studio Black Lilah Faux-Leather CoatMejuri Bold Huggie HoopsALOHAS Nash Ankle BootBack to Basics For a tried-and-true workwear look, consider a sleek pencil skirt and a simple sweater—which feels like a classic office ensemble. I suggest opting for a neutral shade (like this gorgeous khaki), styled with a black top and simple slingbacks. (Emma Watson knows this all too well). From your daily commute to long travel days, there’s nowhere this ensemble won’t work. Plus, it’s great for the weeks in between seasons when you transition from one wardrobe to the next. html:
Winter is, inevitably, a tough season to dress for—and even more so at the office. With the weather fluctuating between freezing and mild, it’s easy to reach for your standard knit sweaters, long-sleeve dresses, wool trousers, tights, and boots. That said, even the most creative dressers can find themselves in a sartorial rut every now and then. So, allow me to reinvigorate your wardrobe with some new winter workwear inspiration.

Ahead, I’ve rounded up some of the chicest office-appropriate ensembles to inspire your next cold-weather outfit. Taking a page from the most stylish celebrities and street style mavens, you’ll quickly see that the art of layering (particularly with outerwear and knits) will be crucial to master this season, whether that involves throwing on a blazer, draping a sweater over your shoulders, or even switching between a trench coat and a puffer jacket. I’ve also provided options that run the range of dress codes—so, yes, there are some really good winter work outfits with jeans included.

So, what are you waiting for? Find your next work look below.

Cold-Weather Leather

A long leather skirt styled with an oversized blazer and tall boots is the perfect (and foolproof) outfit for when you want a chic and elevated look. Make it a monochromatic by matching your skirt to your top and tie it all together with a belt for a subtle but impactful detail—the contrast of your jacket makes it really pop.

Alice + Olivia Macey Denim Notch-Collar Fitted Blazer

AGOLDE Karla Tank

Now 61% Off

Camila Coelho Anabella Leather Maxi Skirt

By Anthropologie Wide Corset Belt

Stuart Weitzman Naomi 50MM Crocodile-Embossed Leather Boots

Ray-Ban 53MM Pillow Sunglasses

Winter Jeans and a Tee

When your office runs on the casual side—or you work from home—a simple outfit like this one is a no-brainer. Throw on your favorite loafers and a long wool coat, and you’re good to go.

Toteme Classic Doublé Wool Coat

Buck Mason Surplus Rib Scoop Neck Tank

AGOLDE Harper Jeans

Madewell The Grayson Penny Loafer

Givenchy Cat-Eye Sunglasses

David Yurman Madison Necklace with Toggle

All-Black Everything

You can never go wrong with dark neutrals in the winter, especially an all-black ensemble. And when you pair it with sleek earrings and classic pumps like the newly engaged Selena Gomez, it’ll become your go-to winter work outfit.

Banana Republic Barathea Relaxed Italian Wool Tuxedo Jacket

Banana Republic High-Rise Wide-Leg Wool Pant

Bardot Como Bodysuit

Stuart Weitzman Stuart Power Pumps

Toteme Double Clasp Leather Belt

Gorjana Preston Drop Earrings

The Updated Cardigan

An oversized wool cardigan adds a cozy layer to your outfit, especially when the freezing temps are outside of the office and inside. Take a cue from Jennifer Lopez and wear yours over a black leather skirt and a classic button-up collared shirt for the quintessential layered winter look.

Polo Ralph Lauren Relaxed-Fit Cotton Shirt

Joe’s Jeans The Martine Maxi Skirt

The Frankie Shop Emi Long Felted Wool Cardigan

Monica Vinader Siren Muse Chunky Medium Hoop Earrings

Now 50% Off

Celine 60mm Flat Top Sunglasses

Stuart Weitzman Everitt 80 Bootie

Now 40% Off

Classic Suiting

Go back to business casual basics with a matching grey suit à la Phoebe Dynevor. For a modern take, wear a colorful tank underneath and pair it with leather boots. After all, the most reliable option in the winter is sometimes the best, especially with the unpredictability of the weather.

Mango Pinstripe Suit Jacket

Mango Pinstripe Suit Trousers

Joe’s Jeans The Lucia Single-Breasted Coat

Aritzia Contour Squareneck Cami Hip Tank

Everlane The City Boot

Zoe Lev Jewelry 14k Gold Small Huggie Earrings

Scandi Chic

Nothing feels quite as chic as a winter coat with faux-fur trim—just ask Alessandra Ambrosio (as well as all the Danish girls sporting the style). Style it with a cashmere and wool turtleneck sweater, which adds luxe and warmth. Without a doubt, this is an outerwear staple that dresses up just about anything: skirts, trousers, your trusted denim jeans, you name it. And don’t forget a pair of kitten-heeled boots, the ultimate winter work shoe.

Vince Wool & Cashmere-Blend Turtleneck Sweater

Levi’s Ribcage Full Length Jeans

Saint Laurent Beveled Acetate Cat-Eye Sunglasses

Stand Studio Black Lilah Faux-Leather Coat

Mejuri Bold Huggie Hoops

ALOHAS Nash Ankle Boot

Back to Basics

For a tried-and-true workwear look, consider a sleek pencil skirt and a simple sweater—which feels like a classic office ensemble. I suggest opting for a neutral shade (like this gorgeous khaki), styled with a black top and simple slingbacks.

Banana Republic Luxe Wool-Blend Elbow-Sleeve Top

Veronica Beard Kimpton Pencil Skirt

Now 25% Off

Prada Leather Belt

Schutz Ciara Croco Kitten Slingback Pumps

Dior Black Suit A3U Pilot Sunglasses 59mm

Ferragamo 25mm Ferragamo Duo Mini Watch

The Transition-Ready Ensemble

Layering is all about versatility, and this outfit is just about as versatile as it gets. (Emma Watson knows this all too well). From your daily commute to long travel days, there’s nowhere this ensemble won’t work. Plus, it’s great for the weeks in between seasons when you transition from one wardrobe to the next. And when you’re feeling chilly at the office, throw on your favorite cashmere sweater to stay warm.

Barbour Gwyn Showerproof Trench

J.Crew Wren Slim Shirt

Now 59% Off

Khaite Danielle High-Rise Straight-Leg Jeans

Sézane Albane Loafers

Polo Ralph Lauren Julianna Cable-Knit Cashmere Sweater

Celine Triomphe 52MM Oval Sunglasses

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
